members.text: This is a recontruction of right-wing populist argumentation based on the electoral platform of the German party "Alternative fr Deutschland" (AfD) from 2017. A commented version of the reconstruction can be found here. It is only available in German, however.
members.title: Untitled 1

members.text: I'll begin by making explicit the core argument which, as I claim, also represents the basic structure of populist argumentation in general.
members.title: Untitled 2

members.text: The basic idea of the core argument is that populists have to come to power because only they can save society from imminent doom. The argument builds then on several further arguments for why this should be the case. But let's first look at the core argument itself in more detail.
members.title: Untitled 3
Power
members.text: The populists must come to power. #populism

members.title: Power
members.text: The populists must come to power.

members.title: Doom
members.text: Society is doomed and must be saved. #populism

members.title: Doom
members.text: Society is doomed and must be saved.

members.title: Salvation
members.text: Society can only be saved, if the populists come to power. #populism

members.title: Salvation
members.text: Society can only be saved, if the populists come to power.
The second premise is supported by an argument, which could be said to be quintessentially populist according to the political scientist Jan-Werner Mller.
members.title: Untitled 4
Will of the People
members.text: Society can only be saved, if the will of the people is realized. #populism

members.title: Voice of the People
members.text: Only if the populists come to power, the will of the people will be realized. #populism

members.title: Voice of the People
members.text: Only if the populists come to power, the will of the people will be realized.

members.title: Voice of the People
members.text: Only if the populists come to power, the will of the people will be realized.

members.title: Voice of the People
members.text: Only if the populists come to power, the will of the people will be realized.

members.title: Voice of the People
members.text: Only if the populists come to power, the will of the people will be realized.

What follows are arguments supporting the second premise @[Voice of the People] of the argument @<Salvation by the People>. Three distinct arguments can be identified in the electoral platform of the AfD. Note that the numbers behind the statements refer to the sections in the original electoral platform.
members.title: Untitled 5

members.text: The first argument is based on the populists' critique of the so called "establishment".
members.title: Untitled 6
Political Alternative
members.text: Apart from the "establishment" only the populists can come to power. #establishment

members.title: Lost Connection
members.text: The "establishment" does not want to and cannot realize the popular will. (1.7) #establishment

members.title: Realization
members.text: The will of the people will only be realized if a party comes to power that wants to and can realize the will of the people. #establishment
The following argument supports the premise @[Lost Connection] of the previous argument.
members.title: Untitled 7
Corruption and Inability
members.text: The "establishment" is corrupt and incompetent. (1.7) #establishment

members.title: Will and Ability
members.text: If the "establishment" is corrupt and incompetent, it cannot and will not realize the will of the people. #establishment
The second argument is based on the populists' critique of supranational organisations and treaties.
members.title: Untitled 8
No People's Will in EU
members.text: The will of the people will only be realized if we leave the EU. (1.1) #eu

members.title: Exit from EU
members.text: Only the populists have the political goal of leaving the EU. #eu
The following argument supports the premise @[No People's Will in EU] of the previous argument.
members.title: Untitled 9
No Nationality in EU
members.text: If we stay within the EU, there is no national statehood. (1.1) #eu

members.title: No Nationality, No Sovereignty
members.text: Without national statehood, there is no sovereignty of the people. #eu

members.title: No Sovereignty, No Democracy
members.text: Without sovereignty of the people, there is no democracy. #eu

members.title: No Democracy, No People's Will
members.text: The will of the people will only be realized if democracy is restored. #eu
The third argument is based on the populists' critique of the media.
members.title: Untitled 10
"Fake News" and Censorship
members.text: Freedom of expression will not be subject to any restriction or censorship unless the "fake news" is abolished. (9.5) #news

members.title: Abolition of the "Fake News"
members.text: The "fake news" will only be abolished if populists come to power. #news

Will of the People and Censorship.title: Will of the People and Censorship

members.title: Will of the People and Censorship
members.text: The will of the people will only be realized if freedom of expression is not subject to any restrictions or censorship. #news
The following argument supports the premise @["Fake News" and Censorship] of the previous argument.
members.title: Untitled 11
"Political Correctness"
members.text: If the "fake news" prevails, the parties continue to use the instrument of "political correctness" and bring the press in line. #news

members.title: Opinion Formation
members.text: If the parties continue to use the instrument of "political correctness" and bring the press in line, the freedom of expression will be limited and censored. (9.4) #news

What follows are arguments supporting the first premise @[Doom] of the argument @<Core Argument>. Eight distinct arguments can be identified in the electoral platform of the AfD. The four most important have been highlighted. They tackle the themes of immigration, Islam, crime, and culture. Again the conclusions of all these arguments are identical to the premise @[Doom] of the core argument.
members.title: Untitled 12

members.text: Here is an overview:
members.title: Untitled 13

members.text: First, the arguments that are most dominant in the electoral platform are concerned with immigration.
members.title: Untitled 14
Destabilization
members.text: Immigration to Europe threatens to destabilize society. (5.1) #immigration
The current laws and measures don't suffice to prevent destabilization. #immigration
members.title: Untitled 15

members.text: If society is threatened by destabilization and the current laws and measures don't suffice to prevent destabilization, it is doomed and must be saved. (5.1) #immigration
members.title: Untitled 16

members.text: Society is doomed and must be saved.
members.title: Untitled 17
Crime Rates Increase
members.text: The rise in crime intensifies the security situation dramatically. (4.1) #crime
Second, connected to, but different from immigration are arguments concerned with Islam and crime.
members.title: Untitled 18

members.text: Islam threatens society by alienating its culture and attacking it through terrorist attacks.
members.title: Untitled 19

members.text: A society that is alienated from its culture and attacked by terrorist attacks is doomed and must be saved.
members.title: Untitled 20

members.text: Society is doomed and must be saved.
members.title: Untitled 21
Inadequate Security Measures
members.text: The current laws and measures are an inadequate response to the dramatically worsening security situation. (4.1, 4.3) #crime
If the response to the dramatically worsening security situation is inadequate, society is doomed and must be saved.
members.title: Untitled 22

members.text: Society is doomed and must be saved.
members.title: Untitled 23

members.text: Also central to the electoral platform are arguments concerned with the perceived decline of the "German identity-creating culture".
members.title: Untitled 24
Threat to Culture
members.text: The identity-creating culture of society is in danger. (9.1) #culture
Society cannot exist without an identity-creating culture.
members.title: Untitled 25

members.text: Society is doomed and must be saved.
members.title: Untitled 26

members.text: Somewhat less important are arguments concerned with social injustice, healthcare, demography, and globalization, all of which nevertheless have as their conclusion @[Doom].
